TEXT.German: [TAB]Der siebte Elembiuos, der Rummel, so lange habe ich auf diesen Tag gewartet. Viele hätten sich über den abgelegenen Posten in diesem verkommenen kleinen Bergdorf namens Maledor beschwert, der mir zugeteilt wurde, aber dennoch gibt es dabei einen Vorteil: Die Grenze zum Reich der Balseraph.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Rummel findet in allen Reichen statt. Die Schiffe der Lanun vertauen sich zu großen schwimmenden Inseln auf denen Rum und Wein frei fließen, die Hippus veranstalten Rennen und die Bannor, so sagt man, dürfen 15 Minuten zu spät auf ihren Posten sein. Aber keines dieser Festivitäten kann dem der Balsperaphs das Wasser reichen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Feier der Balseraphs dauert mehrere Tage an und oftmals schlüpfen Fremde in die Städte der Balseraphs um die Feierlichkeiten zu genießen. Streitigkeiten und Kriege sind vergessen, viele Bezirke verbieten sie sogar und die meisten Religionen erklären sie für unmoralisch. Deshalb haben es sich Fremde angewöhnt sich in Masken und Kostüme zu hüllen, um zu verhindern dass sie von Mitbürgern oder Mitgliedern der örtlichen Glaubensgemeinschaft erkannt werden. Aber der Hauptgrund dafür ist der, dass sie nicht erkannt werden, wenn sie sich der Orgie anschließen, die sie eigentlich nur als Zeugen beobachten wollten, die sie aber nach einem Nachmittag voller Dampf und Wein deutlich auf einem deutlich persönlicherem Level genießen.[PARAGRAPH:1] Beim Beobachten der Dorfbesucher sah ich in einer Stunde mehr, als in einer Lebenszeit. Goblins, Elfen, sogar ein sperriger Golem, den ein zwerg in einem Korb auf dessen Rücken ritt, donnerte vorbei. Ein Komödiant mit einer Puppe auf dem Kopf verfolgte den Golem spotthaft. Schauspieler auf einer Bühne mit schwarzem Hintergrund spielten eine Geschichte in der Esus von einem Mann gespielt wurde, dessen Körper zur Hälfte weiß und zur Hälfte schwarz war. Wenn er sich nach rechts drehte, waren er und sie Aktionen klar zu erkennen, drehte er sich jedoch nach links, war er wegen des schwarzen Hintergrunds unsichtbar.Verschiedenste andere Schauspieler spielten die Rollen der Götter und Menschen und wurden regelmäßig von verschwindenden Gott ausgetrickst.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wäre ich ein weiser Mann gewesen, hätte ich dort eingehalten, aber geschützt von der porezellanen Sicherheit meiner Maske warf ich einige Münzen in die Hände eines taubengesichtigen Kobolds und betrat ein schwarzrotes Zelt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Im Inneren hingen soviele Heuschrecken an den Zeltwänden, das deren Material kaum noch zu erkennen war. Sie brummten und drückten sich aneinander und erfüllten den Raum so mit einem seltsamen Klicken, das bei mir eine Gänsehaut hervorrief. Kurze Ketten hingen von der Decke wie ein himmlisches Glockenspiel, und sie schwangen hin und her, getrieben von einer unrealen Briese, oftmals sogar in gegensätzliche Richtungen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Boden war, bis auf eine Strohmatte, einem kleinem Tisch und einem verkümmerten Mann in einer eintönigen brauner Robe, leer.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Knie nieder" sagte er während er auf die Strohmatte wies.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Das Schild versprach prophetische Visionen, ist das möglich?" Während ich das sagte kniete ich auf der Matte, mehr von Bedenken über das verschwendete Geld geplagt, als darüber dass mir etwas zustoßen könnte. Nach dem Anblick eines kleinen Dämonen der als Portier diente war ein Zelt voller gehorsamer Käfer und unfolgsamen Ketten wenig beeindruckend.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Prophezeiungen sind einfach, ich müsste dir nur zeigen wie du das Zelt verlässt, eine Mahlzeit isst oder ins Bett gehst, um diese Pflicht zu erfüllen. An jeder Ecke findest du einen Propheten, der daran glaubt eine nützliche Bestimmung zu erfüllen indem er uns vor einer aufkommen Apokalypse oder etwas anderem warnt. Tod, Seuchen, Hungersnöte, Krieg, alles das sind Dinge die es immer gab und immer geben wird. Es ist keine Kunst sie vorherzusagen." [PARAGRAPH:1]Er nahm eine kleine goldene Nadel vom Tisch und steckte eine winzige Kerze in ihr kegelförmiges Ende. Dann tastete er sich an meiner Stirn entlang und strich dem Nacken entlang, bis er die Stelle fand die er suchte und in die er mir die Nadel tief einstach.[PARAGRAPH:1]Während er arbeitete sprach er weiter.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Du wirst deine Zukunft kennenlernen, du wirst das sehen was ist und das, was noch sein wird. Du wirst aufstehen als ein neuer Mensch."[PARAGRAPH:1]Nachdem er Dutzende von Nadeln in mich eingestochen hatte begann er damit die winzigen Kerzen in ihnen zu entzünden. Langsam schmolz das Wachs und floß durch den hohlen Nadelschaft in mein Blut. Ich starrte auf die Heuschrecken, die auf den Wänden auf und ab gingen, lauschte den Ketten wie sie über mir aufeinander schlugen, doch diese Sinne glitten immer weiter von mir fort. Ich spürte wie Last meines Körpers von mir fiel und ich schwebte in einem Dunst der Euphorie durch das Zelt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Als ich mich im Zelt umschaute, bemerkte ich dass auch andere Menschen anwesend waren. Seltsam graue Menschen die an den Ketten, die von der Decke hingen, festgemacht waren. Eine junge Frau wand sich und zog an der Kette, nur um sich auszustrecken bevor sie zurück gezogen wurde. Aber die meisten Anderen, und es waren Dutzende von Anderen, flogen durch den Raum und blickten mich mit einem seltsamen Blick voll Trauer und Betroffenheit an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die euphorische Kraft in mir war jedoch so stark, dass selbst die Vision der geisterhaften Beobachter mich nicht beunruhigte. Als ich aber nach unten blickte, sah ich meinen eigenen Körper unter mir. Nadeln waren an dutzenden Stellen zu sehen und brannten weiterhin. Der verkümmerte Mann bewegte sich um meinen Körper und vergewisserte sich, dass er weiterhin knieend und ruhig blieb. Dann blickte er nach oben, dorthin wo ich schwebte und blickte direkt in meine schläfrigen Augen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Das war das erste Mal dass ich bemerkte dass etwas nicht stimmte. Ich versuchte zurück zu meinem Körper zu schweben, ich drosch auf die Luft ein, doch ich bewegte mich nicht. Der verkümmerte Mann wirkte von meinem Flattern gestört. Er griff nach einer unbenutzten Kette, griff mich aus der Luft und hing mich daran an. Meine Gewichtlosigkeit war verschwunden, stattdessen war die Kette meine neue Welt und all mein Gewicht schien auf ihr zu lasten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gehalten von der Kette konnte ich nur zusehen wie der Mann zur Wand ging und er Heuschrecken davon herunternahm. Dann ging er zurück zu meinem knieenden Körper im zentrum des Raums, öffnete meinen Mund und ermöglichte es so der Heuschrecke hineinzukriechen. Ich konnte das leichte Kratzen der Heuschreckenfüße auf meiner Zunge schwach spüren, ebenso den harten Panzer der Kreatur als sie gegen Rachen stößt und schließlich den Hals hinabrutscht und plötzlich spürte ich intensiven Schmerz.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ich schrie und in diesem Moment war die Welt zerstört. Jede Person, jeder Ort und jedes Objekt dass ich jemals sah oder mir vorgestellt hatte war verschwunden und für eine kurze Sekunde war ich alleine in einer Welt von perfekter Leere. Dann wurde alles wiederhergestellt, Stück für Stück kam zurück bis die klobige Schöpfung wiederhergestellt war und ich erneut an der Kette an der Spitze des Zelts schwebte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Unter mir stand mein Körper und unterhielt sich mit dem Mann, doch der Gesichtsausdruck war nicht meiner. Es war ein finsterer Anblick ohne jedes Mitgefühl. Ich konnte nichts anderes tun als zuzusehen, als diese neue Version meiner Selbst meine Porzellanmaske aufhob, mein Gesicht bedeckte und das Zelt verließ.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il 7° di Elembiuos, la Baldoria, a lungo ho atteso questo giorno. Molti si sarebbero lamentati della postazione remota a cui sono stato assegnato, un piccolo squallido villaggio di montagna chiamato Maledor, ma ha una cosa positiva, confina con l'impero Balseraph.[PARAGRAPH:1]La Baldoria è celebrata in tutte le culture. Le navi Lanun si attaccano l'un l'altra formando grandi isole gallegianti dove il vino e il rum scorrono liberamente, gli Hippus fanno gare di cavalli e si dice che i Bannor possano arrivare sino a 15 minuti in ritardo alla loro postazione. Ma nessuna di quelle festività può essere paragonata a quella Balseraph.[PARAGRAPH:1]La celebrazione Balseraph dura parecchi giorni e spesso gli stanieri si intrufulano nelle città Balseraph per godersela. Controversie e guerre sono dimenticate, nella maggior parte dei paesi è illegale andarci, e la maggior parte delle religioni la definiscono immorale. Quindi gli stranieri hanno iniziato a indossare maschere e elaborati costumi per evitare di essere riconosciuti da eventuali concittadini e membri della parrocchia locale. Ancor più importante è che impedisce che vengano riconosciuti quando prendono parte nella dissolutezza che volevano soltanto osservare, ma dopo una serata di vapori e vino se la stanno, senza dubbio, godendo a un livello più personale.[PARAGRAPH:1]In un ora ho visto più che in una vita osservando i viaggiatori del villaggio. Goblin, elfi, un gigantesco golem tuonato da un nano che era in una cesta sulla sua schiena. Un giullare con un pupazzo sulla testa seguiva il golem in un finto inseguimento. Degli attori su un palco con uno sfondo nero rapresentavao una storia dove Esus veniva interpretato da un uomo che aveva metà del suo corpo bianco e l'altra metà nero. Quando si voltava sulla destra era chiaramente visibile in tutte le sue azioni, ma quando si voltava sulla sinistra diventava invisibile contro il nero dello sfondo. Altri vari attori interpretavano i ruoli degli dei e deglu uomini ed erano regolarmente superati in astuzia dal dio che scompariva.[PARAGRAPH:1]Se fossi stato un'uomo saggio mi sarei fermato li, ma al sicuro dietro la mia maschera di porcellana feci cadere alcune monete nelle mani di un Imp dalla faccia di piccione e entrai in una tenda dai drappeggi rossi e neri.[PARAGRAPH:1]All'interno c'erano cosi tante locuste sulle pareti di tela che era difficile vederne il materiale. Saltando e scontrandosi tra di loro riempivano la stanza di spiacevoli schiocchi, che mi fecero accapponare la pelle. Delle corte catene erano appese al soffitto come fossero scacciapensieri, e oscillavano come se fossero spinte da una brezza che non c'era, spesso in direzioni opposte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il pavimento era completamente sgombro tranne che per una stuoia di paglia, un piccolo tavolo e un'uomo raggrinzito in una veste marrone scuro.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Inginocchiati" disse indicando la stuoia di paglia.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Il cartello prometteva visioni profetiche, é possibile?" chiesi mentre mi inginocchiavo, innervosito più dal fatto di aver sprecato dei soldi che da qualsiasi danno che mi poteva essere fatto. Dopo aver visto un piccolo demone fare da portiere e avere una tenda piena di obbedienti insetti e disobbedienti catene non era cosi impressionante.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Fare profezie è facile, dovrei soltanto mostrarti che esci da questa tenda, mangiare un'altro pasto o andare a dormire in un letto per adempiere a tale impegno. C'è un profeta dietro ogni angolo, che crede di avere una qualche utilità avvisandoci di un'apocalisse o altro. Morte, peste, carestia, guerra, ci sono sempre state e ci saranno sempre, non ci vuole alcun dono per prevederle".[PARAGRAPH:1]Prese un sottile ago d'oro dal tavolo e vi inserì una piccola candela nella sua estremità affusolata. Poi tastò la base del mio cranio e scese lungo il collo sino a quando non trovò il punto che stava cercando e inserì l'ago profondamente nella mia pelle.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mentre lavorava continuò a parlare.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Scoprirai il tuo futuro, vedrai ciò che è e ciò che sarà. Uscirai da qui come un'uomo nuovo."[PARAGRAPH:1]Dopo aver inserito dozzine di questi aghi d'oro iniziò ad accendere le piccole candele che vi erano dentro. Lentamente la cera si sciolse, scorse nel fusto cavo e infine nel mio sangue. Fissai le locuste che facevano avanti e indietro sulle pareti, ascoltai le catene sbattere tra di loro sopra di me ma i sensi andavano via via più alla deriva. Sentii il peso del mio corpo staccarsi da me e io fluttuai annebbiato dall'euforia.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guardando in giro per la tenda notai che c'erano altre persone. Strane persone grigie che erano aggangiate alle catene che erano attaccate al soffitto. Una giovane donna si contorse e tirò la sua catena, senza però riuscire a liberarsi da essa. Ma la maggior parte degli altri, e ce n'erano dozzine, fluttuavano semplicemente per la tenda fissandomi con uno sguardo di tristezza e preoccupazione.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tale era la mia euforia che anche la visione di questi spettatori spettrali non mi infastidì. Ma quando guardai giù vidi il mio corpo sotto di me. Gli aghi spuntavano da una dozzina di posti e continuavano a bruciare. L'uomo raggrinzito si mosse attorno al mio corpo, assicurandosi che rimanesse in ginocchio e a riposo. Poi guardò verso il punto in cui fluttuavo sopra il mio corpo e guardò nei miei occhi assonnati.[PARAGRAPH:1]Questo fu il primo momento in cui ho capito che qualcosa non andava. Cercai di tornare al mio corpo, agitandomi nell'aria, ma non mi muovevo. L'uomo raggrinzito sembrò infastidito dal mio muovermi. Prese una catena inutilizzata e poi mi afferrò in aria agganciandomi ad essa. La mia leggerezza sparì, e la catena divenne il mio nuovo mondo e tutto il mio peso sembrava ricadere su di essa.[PARAGRAPH:1]Trattenuto dalla catena potei solamente guardare mentre l'uomo raggrinzito camminò verso il muro e prese una locusta. Poi tornò al mio corpo inginocchiato al centro della stanza, aprì la bocca e permise alla locusta di entrarci. Potevo sentire vagamente le zampe della locusta graffiare la lingua, il guscio duro della creatura sul palato e nella gola, e poi un dolore improvviso e intenso.[PARAGRAPH:1]Urlai, e in quel momento il mondo venne distrutto. Ogni persona, posto e oggetto che avevo mai visto o immaginato erano spariti e per un secondo ero da solo in un mondo perfettamente vuoto. Poi tutto tornò come prima, pezzo dopo pezzo la creazione fu ripristinata e io ero tornato a fluttuare legato alla catena in cima alla tenda.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sotto di me il mio corpo stava parlando con l'uomo raggrinzito, ma l'espressione sul mio viso non era la mia. Era uno sguardo oscuro senza compassione. Non potevo fare altro che guardare mentre questa nuova versione di me prendeva la maschera di porcellana, la indossava e usciva dalla tenda.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The 7th of Elembiuos, the Revelry, long have I waited for this day. Many would have complained about the remote post I have been assigned, a squalid little mountain village called Maledor, but it does have one advantage, it borders the Balseraph empire.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Revelry is celebrated in all cultures. Lanun ships moor themselves together into large floating islands where the wine and rum flow freely, the Hippus hold races and the Bannor are said to be able to come to their post up to 15 minutes late. But none of the festivals compare to the Balseraphs.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Balseraphs celebration lasts several days and foreigners often slip over into Balseraph cities to enjoy it. Disputes and wars are forgotten, most countries make it illegal to go, and most religions call it immoral. So foreigners have taken to wearing masks and elaborate costumes to keep from being recognized by fellow citizens and members of their local parish. Most importantly it keeps them from being recognized when they partake in the debauchery that they intended only to witness, but after an evening of vapors and vinum they are no doubt enjoying at a more personal level.[PARAGRAPH:1]In an hour I have seen more than in a lifetime watching village travelers. Goblins, elves, a hulking golem thundered by with a dwarf riding in a basket on its back. A jester with a puppet on his head followed the golem in mock pursuit. Actors on a stage with a black background enacted a tale where Esus was played by a man with half of his body in white, and half in black. When he turned to the right he was clearly visible in all his actions, but when he turned to the left he was invisible against the black of the stage. Various other actors played the roles of gods and men and were routinely outwitted by the disappearing god.[PARAGRAPH:1]If I was a wise man I would have stopped there, but behind the safety of my porcelain mask I dropped a few coins into the hands of a pigeon faced Imp and entered a tent draped in black and reds.[PARAGRAPH:1]Inside so many locusts hung on the canvas walls that little of the material could be seen. They buzzed and pushed against each other, filling the room with an odd clicking that made my skin crawl. Shorts chains hung from the ceiling like wind chimes, and they swayed and pulled to some unfelt breeze, often in opposite directions.[PARAGRAPH:1]The floor of the room was clear but for a straw mat, a small table and a withered man in drab brown robes.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Kneel" he said motioning toward the straw mat.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The sign promised prophetic visions, is that possible?" I knelt on the mat as I spoke, more nervous that I had wasted my money than that any harm would come to me. After seeing a small demon serving as doorman and making change a tent full of obedient bugs and disobedient chains wasn't that impressive.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Prophecy is easy, I would have only to show you leaving this tent, eating another meal or going to sleep in a bed to fulfill that obligation. There is a prophet on every corner, believing they serve some useful purpose by warning us of one overblown apocalypse or another. Death, plague, famine, war, these have always been, will always be, it takes no art to predict that."[PARAGRAPH:1]He picked up a thin gold needle from the table an inserted a tiny candle in its tapered end. He then felt along the base of my skull and down along my neck until he found the spot he wanted and inserted the needle deep into my skin.[PARAGRAPH:1]He continued to talk as he worked.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You will learn your future, you will see that which is and that which will be. You will leave here a new man."[PARAGRAPH:1]After inserting dozens of these golden needles he began to light the tiny candles within them. Slowly the wax melted, flowed down the hollow shaft and into my blood. I stared at the locusts shifting back and forth on the walls, listened to the chains hitting against each other above me but these senses drifted farther and farther away. I felt the weight of my body drop from me and I floated there in the tent in the haze of euphoria.[PARAGRAPH:1]Looking around the tent I noticed other people were here too. Strange grey people who were hooked to the chains that hung from the ceiling. A young woman writhed and pulled against her chain, stretching out from it before being pulled back. But most of the others, and there were dozens of others, simply floated around the tent staring at me with a look of sadness and concern.[PARAGRAPH:1]Such was the power of my euphoria that even the vision of these ghostly watchers didn't bother me. But when I looked down I saw my own body beneath me. Needles poked out of a dozen locations and continued to burn. The withered man moved around my body, making sure it remained kneeling and at rest. Then he looked up at where I floated above my body, looked into my drowsy eyes.[PARAGRAPH:1]This was the first moment I realized something was wrong. I tried to float back down to my body, flailing in the air but I didn't move. The withered man looked annoyed by my thrashing. He reached for an unused chain and then grabbed me out of the air and hooked me on it. My weightlessness was gone, instead the chain was my new world and all of my weight seemed to fall upon it.[PARAGRAPH:1]Held by the chain I could only watch as the withered man walked over to the wall and plucked one of the locusts off of it. Then he walked back to my kneeling body in the center of the room, opened my mouth and allowed the locust to crawl into it. I could vaguely feel the tiny scratches of locust feet on my tongue, the creature's hard shell pushing against the back of my mouth and down my throat, and then sudden and intense pain.[PARAGRAPH:1]I screamed, and in that moment the world was destroyed. Every person, place and object I had ever seen or imagined was gone and for a brief second I was alone in a world of perfect emptiness. Then everything was remade, piece by clumsy piece they came back together until creation was restored and I was back floating on the chain at the top of the tent.[PARAGRAPH:1]Beneath me my body stood talking to the withered man, but the expression on my face was not my own. It was a dark look without compassion. I could do nothing but watch as this new version of me picked up my porcelain mask, covered my face and left the tent.

TEXT.English: It required retrofitting the entire spring mechanism for the awkward shape, replacing the wheels to compensate for the change in center of gravity, and lengthening the lever arm so the beasts would stay put. But Perpentach wanted to see cows fly, and his engineers weren't going to deny him.
TEXT.French: Ça a requis de modifier entièrement le mécanisme pour son usage étrange, remplaçant les roues pour compenser les changements du centre de gravité, et allongeant le bras de levier pour que les bêtes restent en place. Mais Perpentach voulait voir des vaches voler, et ses ingénieurs n'allaient sûrement pas l'en dissuader.
TEXT.German: Es war nötig gewesen, den gesamten Wurfmechanismus für diese unpraktische Form neu zu entwerfen, die Räder zu ersetzen, um die Schwerpunktverlagerung auszugleichen und den Wurfarm zu verlängern, damit ermöglicht wird, dass Tiere an Ort und Stelle stehen bleiben würden. Aber Perpentach wollte Kühe fliegen sehen und seine Ingenieure waren nicht im stande ihm dies zu verwehren.

TEXT.English: Courtesans live charmed lives, floating socially above the peasantry like a cloud above the plains. Few Kingdoms have never had courtesans to attend to the nobility's desire for a pretty face, witty tongue, and often baser talents. The Balseraphs however utilized courtesans offensively throughout the Age of Rebirth, as covert information gatherers initially. A smile would often get them past a lonely border guard, and a bit more could earn entrance to the capital. Later they would find ways to make themselves much more useful, acting as a camp follower, then killing important enemy figures and disappearing into the night.
TEXT.French: Les Courtisanes vivent une vie charmante, flottant socialement au-dessus de la paysannerie comme un nuage au-dessus des plaines. Peu de Royaumes n'ont jamais eu de coutisanes au service des attentes de la noblesse vis à vis d'un jolis minois, d'une langue pleine d'esprit, et souvent de talents plus basiques. Les Balséraphs ont cependant utilisé les courtisanes plus agressivement, tout au long de l'Âge de la Renaissance, au départ en tant qu'informateurs sous couverture. Un sourire leur permettait souvent de passer un poste de douane isolé, et un peu plus ouvrait l'accès à la capitale. Plus tard, elle trouveraient d'autres moyens de se rendre utiles, agissant en qualité d'aide de camp, puis assassinant une figure importante chez l'ennemi avant de disparaître dans la nuit.
TEXT.German: Kurtisanen leben bezauberte Leben, schweben sozial über der Bauernschafft, wie eine Wolke über den Ebenen. Wenige Königreiche haben niemals Kurtisanen gehabt, die dem Wunsch des Adels nach einem hübschen Gesicht, einer gewitzten Zunge und fundamentaleren Talenten dienen. Doch die Balseraph machten sich die Kurtisanen durch das Zeitalter der Wiedergeburt offensiv zu nutze, als heimliche Informationssammler. Ein Lächeln pflegte sie öfter an einem einsamen Grenzwächter vorbeizubringen und etwas mehr könnte ihnen den Zugang zur Hauptstadt verschaffen. Später würden sie Wege finden sich noch viel nützlicher zu machen, indem sie so taten, als wären zu Angehörige des Lagers, um dann wichtige feindliche Persönlichkeiten auszuschalten und in die Nacht zu verschwinden.
TEXT.Italian: Le Cortigiane vivono vite affascinanti, stando socialmente sopra i contadini come le uvole stanno sopra le pianure. Pochi regni non avevano mai avuto delle cortigiane per soddisfare il desiderio della nobiltà per un bel viso, una lingua arguta e spesso per abilità meno nobili. I Balseraph però utilizzarono le cortigiane in modo diverso durante l'Era della Rinascita, ovvero come raccoglitrici di informazioni segrete, inizialmente. Un sorriso gli permetteva spesso di oltrepassare una guardia di confine solitaria, e un pò di più l'avrebbe fatta entrare nella capitale. In seguito avrebbero trovato dei modi per rendersi molto più utili, come comportarsi come un servitore da campo per poi uccidere figure nemiche importanti e sparire nel pieno della notte.

Few Kingdoms have never had courtesans to attend to the nobility's desire for a pretty face, witty tongue, and often baser talents. The Balseraphs however utilized courtesans offensively throughout the Age of Rebirth, as covert information gatherers initially. A smile would often get them past a lonely border guard, and a bit more could earn entrance to the capital. Later they would find ways to make themselves much more useful, acting as a camp follower, then killing important enemy figures and disappearing into the night.

TEXT.Italian: La Cortigiana è invisibile alla maggior parte delle unità, e attaca l'unità più debole del gruppo. La risposta perfetta contro i Sommi Sacerdoti o gli Arcimaghi.

Und du versuchst mir zu sagen, dass etwas NOCH MEHR Schrecken verbreitet als ein blutrünstiger Harlekin?" - Nial Hocrier, Stadtwächter

TEXT.German: Being able to capture animals for the Balseraph carnivals and use the Taunt ability to cause nearby enemy units to attack their stack, Harlequin's are useful in times of war or peace.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The animals in Keelyn's menagerie stirred uneasily in their sleep as a shadowy figure slipped past their cages. The apparition moved so quietly there was no way it would manage to stir even the most alert ones from slumber, yet, somehow, its passage managed to reach into their simple dreams and turn them sour. The shadow's progress was accompanied by a soft snicker of barely suppressed eagerness and anticipation. It sounded like a naughty schoolboy who was about to play a particularly nasty trick on his teacher.[PARAGRAPH:1]At the end of the row of cages stood a flight of broad, flat steps leading to an opulently carved door, a writhing mass of serpentine forms intertwining across its entire surface. This was the garden entrance to Keelyn's "Playpalace". The palace was decorated in the typical Balseraph manner, with no regard to taste, simplicity or uniformity, but rather treated as an opportunity to fit in as many festive, amusing, intricate, inventive, colorful and shiny details as possible. On the plus side, it provided plenty of footholds for a climber who regarded facades the same way an adventurous child regards trees. On the negative side, someone was so pleased with their work that they had seen fit to magically illuminate the whole thing, even in the middle of the night.[PARAGRAPH:1]The watch post at the aforementioned door shouted "Halt!", and squinted into the darkness, feeling sure he heard someone laughing. The laughing ended in an amused snort, and he caught something moving very fast at the edge of his vision. Before he had a chance to see what it was, it disappeared up the side of the building and through a open window with a skitter and a whoosh. He suddenly felt rather silly, reacting to what must surely have been a squirrel or a bird.[PARAGRAPH:1]The great hall of the palace was decorated like a fairy-tale palace, as envisioned by a particularly deranged practitioner of adult-oriented "art". The myriad candles went out in stages, starting at the front of the hall and moving towards the rear, a settling gloom advancing like a shadowy wave. It was followed by a low, tittering sound, someone laughing at their own personal joke. It was so low, it might as well have been the drafts playing tricks on the ear. The dark veil proceeded with stately dignity up the grand staircase and left the whole room in darkness.[PARAGRAPH:1]A huge Taskmaster on his way from a liaison with a courtesan bellowed "STOP!" at the top of his voice as he saw an unknown person sneaking into the hallway. The skulking figure appeared startled that he had seen him, and made a bolt for the nearest door-a move which brought a smile to the Taskmaster's face. That particular room was a "waiting room" for unwanted guests, specially designed to be unwelcoming and lacking certain amenities, like a floor of any kind. Well, that was not strictly true. There was a hard-packed earth surface about thirty feet below. As far as the Taskmaster was concerned, his intruder problem had solved itself almost as quickly as it had appeared. Then he heard a very conspicuous "creeeeeeak", and turned towards the source. The smile melted off his face as he spotted a jeering, otherworldly visage peering out from a door a little down the hall-since that door, too, led to the floorless chamber. This was obviously one of Keelyn's damned pets on the loose, certainly nothing for a mere mortal to get embroiled in. He had hunted beastmen, and dug dwarves out of their caves, but there were limits. Creatures from the pit... The Taskmaster, feared by so many, turned and ran. A mocking laugh followed him.[PARAGRAPH:1]Strange things happened throughout the palace as, floor by floor, the interloper made his way to the top tower, where Keelyn slept. Magical candles flickered and died, psychedelic spectres plagued the dreams of sleeping courtiers, lovers had their intimate moments rudely interrupted by loud knocking on the door, disembodied laughing or other highly disturbing noises. Guards found themselves nodding off or bursting into fits of uncontrollable giggling. A group of men playing Somnium found that all the money in the kitty had been replace with marbles. Predictably, a fight broke out.[PARAGRAPH:1]The guard in front of Keelyn's door felt himself break into a cold sweat. He had the strangest sensation that someone was standing behind him, but when he spun round, no one was there. The feeling of being watched would not loosen its grip, however. He felt an inexplicable panic rising in him, and began shouting out challenges: "Who goes there? Step forth, and be recognized! Show yourself, or there will be consequences!" He swung around, scanning every darkened corner, hoping to catch a glimpse of whoever was there. He was certain something kept moving on the edge of his vision. His cries became more and more distraught as the fear and panic swelled. Finally, he yelled in desperation: "Dammit, where are you, come out!"[PARAGRAPH:1]A small figure dropped down right in front of his face, its head at the level of his eyes. He focused on it, and found himself staring into a wooden face with large, unblinking, glassy eyes. The guard choked on his cry as the puppet mockingly chattered "Come out, come out, come out!" Then it grabbed his head with both polished hands and twisted sharply, snapping his neck with a merry "crack". He slumped to the ground, his features frozen in a final, surprised grimace. The puppet landed on the guard's lifeless form, and a small brass trumpet descended as well. The puppet seized it clumsily in its right hand, and, as the doors opened of their own accord, it marched through, playing a pompous fanfare that was cut short with a loud BLART and an exaggeratedly comical stumble as the little wooden man was met with the full force of Keelyn's glare. "My bodyguards are not your toys!" she snapped with an admonishing tone of voice.[PARAGRAPH:1]"My bodyguards are not your toys," the puppet repeated petulantly. It's voice was like that of a ventriloquist's dummy, theatrical, high-pitched, unreal and slightly eerie. It stuck a red-painted tongue out at her. "You're not funny, Loki! Come down from there at once, or face the wrath of Chuckles!" the princess commanded. Both puppet and trumpet were abruptly jerked through the door and up, and a spectacularly painted face appeared from above, looking upside down through the door frame. It bore the guilty but pleading expression of a child caught with a hand in the cookie jar and who now had a pretty good idea of what was to follow. Keelyn was stroking a white bunny with mean red eyes, sharp yellow fangs and a hateful expression. The princess' expression was merely stern, but bad enough. "You know what I mean, all the way down." A gangly form dressed in brightly colored clothes unfolded from above and swung through the doorway, landed with a melodramatic flourish, and flashed an unnaturally wide smile. Then, ignoring Keelyn completely, he proceeded to scan the room.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn's chambers appealed to Loki's sense of humor. They contained all the things the bedroom of a princess should contain. On the wall over the balcony was a horse's head, with one single horn protruding from above the glassy eyes. Above her gigantic four-poster bed (tastefully decked out in large pink ribbons, coal-black, oily-looking curtains and a grinning, stylized skull at the top of each corner post) was a painting of her standing beside the hanging corpse of another horse-like creature, this one with wings. In the painting, she had a full-sized winged demon improbably perched on her arm, in the same way a more mundane lord would carry a falcon. Next to the doorway of her dressing room, there was a collection of what appeared to be butterflies, but which, upon closer inspection, were small winged humanoids, pinned in frames. There was a desk, a heavy table-top of deep crimson marble supported by four short, chubby creatures with red cheeks, beards and pointy hats. They looked like their natural state was "jolly", but instead their features were twisted and distorted, as if in the throes of some terrible, unending torment. They were also suspiciously lifelike. Upon this desk there was an inkwell carved from a mummified foot. It was roughly child-sized, and extraordinarily hairy. There was also a fetus, floating in a jar of bluish liquid. One could be forgiven for thinking it was that of dolphin, were it not for the tiny hands and the beginnings of a head and abdomen. Finally, hanging from the roof in a large, gilded cage, there was an imp.[PARAGRAPH:1]The imp stirred in its cage, noticed Loki, and immediately changed shaped to a stunningly beautiful, completely naked young woman, making lewd gestures and sending him sultry looks. Loki watched the display with detached fascination, but no trace of lust. Seeing this, the demon changed to a remarkably pretty, naked young man, but got the same reaction. Then it changed into a little girl and finally a little boy, making seductive gestures all the time. It had no effect on Loki, however, and a look of confusion crossed the young boy's face. Then it started quickly flicking through a number of shapes-a distressed old lady, a crying baby, a puppy dog, wagging its tail and jumping up and down, and on, and on to new forms, faster and faster. Loki was completely enthralled by the display, and Keelyn's voice faded to a faint babble in the background. The babble stopped, and was followed by an outraged cluck, and a snap of the fingers. The imp was flung against the cage, shifted back to its original form, and slumped against the bars.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I did not call you here to waste time looking at the antics of my pets," Keelyn hissed, suppressing what would undoubtedly have been a rather spectacular and possibly destructive tantrum. Loki was glad she did, although also a bit sad at all the mayhem that was now not going to happen, even though it would have been directed at him. "I called you here because I need you to play some tricks on some people. And by the way, it may be that daddy thinks it is funny when you sneak in every time he calls for you, but I don't, so stop it." Loki's expression became a grotesque attempt at portraying a remorseful puppy, and he started making simpering sounds. It was impossible to tell if he was being sarcastic or if he was sincere. Everything Loki did was wildly overdone. If he ever spoke, one imagined it would be florid, pompous, loud, full of artistic pauses, meaningful stresses and careful enunciation, like a self-important tenor in a bad opera. But he never spoke.[PARAGRAPH:1]No one knew if he was mute by choice or compunction, physical, mental or magical. One thing was certain, though: Holding a conversation with Loki was nearly impossible, and frustrating to the point of madness. Not a single reply, he didn't even use sign language. Nothing but a ceaseless stream of outrageous and oft inappropriate expressions and gestures, more confusing than enlightening. This was not a problem for the Clown Prince or his daughter, however; Perpentach didn't seem to notice, and to Keelyn, this was the way things should be. Like all spoilt children, her preferred mode of communication was one-way. She told you what she wanted, and it was done.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The reason I summoned you, is..." She took a deep breath, and Loki cocked a very large, dark green eyebrow quizzically, anticipating his mission. "Is because I summoned a new friend the other day, and he told me there was this place with loads of new pets for me, and I told him I wanted to go this place, and he told me why leave it at that, I could be the Princess, and I thought, my very own Queendom, wouldn't that be grand, and he told me it wouldn't be easy, and then he told me I wouldn't be alone," Keelyn bubbled, and Loki's head bobbed up and down like a lever on a pump as she continued: "The Bannor want to go there too, and the Malakim. And loads of other people too, I think, and I don't want to have to share, but I think maybe I'll have to play with them for a bit because I don't think all of the pets living there will be as friendly as Chuckles and I don't know if I can get daddy to give me enough soldiers to go an' fight them all on my own and that's why I want you to tag along with the other guys and see what you can see and maybe make things a bit difficult for them, but not so much that they are useless for me. Can you do that?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki nodded sagely, but the hungry twinkle in his eye revealed that he could do that, and he could do that very, very well. Keelyn did not fail to notice it. "I knew you'd like this, it is what you're best at. One of my favorite games is following your little trail of destruction and confusion. I even have a map with pins in it. So go on, do your worst. That is my command," she finished, in the regal manner of a young girl who knew she could get whatever she demanded. "And don't kill any more of my guards on the way out. I like the ones I have at the moment."[PARAGRAPH:1]The audience was over. Loki nodded one last time, and his smile turned sinister and appeared to stretch broader than his face. He was obviously looking forward to this. Then he took a run up, ran through the opening between Keelyn's room and the balcony, and jumped. He hung in the air for a split second longer than should be physically possible, and then dived, straight down. Despite herself, Keelyn rushed to the parapet and looked down. Far, far below, a vividly colored figure hopped smartly out of a small fountain, shook the water off, and skipped through the garden. She watched the happy figure until it disappeared through a hedge at the boundary of the garden, bound for untold mischief and pandemonium.
TEXT.French: Les animaux de la ménagerie de Keelyn s'éveillèrent lourdement de leur sommeil tandis qu'une ombre se faufilait entre leurs cages. L'apparition se déplaçait si silencieusement qu'il lui était impossible de tirer de leur sommeil les plus alertes, et pourtant, d'une certaine manière, son passage s'insinua dans leurs rêves simples et les rendit acides. La progression de l'ombre était accompagnée d'un petit rire étouffé à peine contenu de passion refoulée et d'anticipation. Il ressemblait à celui d'un petit garçon désobéissant qui s'apprête à jouer un tour particulièrement vilain à son professeur.[PARAGRAPH:1]À la fin de la série de cages se trouvait une volée de marches larges et plates menant à une porte richement décorée, une masse grouillante de formes serpentines entrelacées sur toute sa surface. C'était l'entrée de jardin du "Palais de Jeu" de Keelyn. Le palais était décoré à la mode typiquement Balséraph, sans recherche de goût, simplicité ou uniformité, mais plutôt traité comme une possibilité de le remplir de détails les plus festifs, amusants, compliqués, inventifs, colorés et brillants possibles. Le bon côté des choses, c'est qu'ils fournissaient une foule de prises pour escalader à celui qui regardaient les murs comme un enfant aventureux regarde un arbre. Le mauvais côté des choses, c'est que quelqu'un appréciait tellement leur travail qu'ils ont pensé judicieux d'illuminer magiquement l'ensemble, même au milieu de la nuit.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le veilleur posté à ladite porte cria "Halte !" et fouilla les ombres, sûr d'avoir entendu quelqu'un rire. Le rire se termina en un grognement amusé, et il aperçu quelque chose du coin de l'oeil bougeant très vite. Avant d'avoir pu voir ce que c'était, ça disparut de la surface du bâtiment à travers une fenêtre avec un bruissement et un souffle. Il se sentit soudain idiot, réagissant à ce qui était sûrement un écureuil ou un oiseau.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Grand hall du palais était décoré comme un château de conte de fée, mais imaginé par un pratiquant particulièrement dérangé de l'art "pour adultes". Les myriades de bougies s'éteignirent par paliers, commençant au début du hall et se poursuivant vers le fond, l'obscurité s'installant s'avançant comme une vague d'ombre. Elle était suivie par un faible ricanement, quelqu'un riant de sa propre blague. C'était si faible qu'il aurait pu passer pour un courant d'air jouant des tours aux oreilles. Le voile noir poursuivit avec une dignité majestueuse jusqu'à la grande cage d'escalier, laissant la pièce complète dans le noir.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un gigantesque contre-maître de retour de son aventure avec une courtisane beugla "STOP !" le plus fort possible en voyant une personne inconnue se faufilant dans le couloir. La figure osseuse parut surprise qu'il la vit, et s'enferma derrière la porte la plus proche - une manœuvre qui amena un sourire sur le visage du Contre-Maître. Cette pièce-là était une "salle d'attente" pour les visiteurs inopportuns, conçue spécialement pour être rebutante et manquant de certains aménagements, tels qu'un quelconque plancher. En fait, ce n'était pas tout à fait vrai. Il y avait un sol de terre battue environ 10 mètres plus bas. Pour le Contre-maître, son problème d'intrus s'était réglé aussi vite qu'il était apparu. Il entendit alors un "griiiiiiincement" très éloquent, et se tourna vers sa source. Son sourire se figea et disparut quand il découvrit un visage railleur et inhumain qui l'épiait depuis une porte en contrebas (puisque cette porte menait également à la pièce sans sol). C'était apparemment un de ces fichus compagnons de Keelyn égaré, sûrement rien de bon pour un simple mortel tel que lui. Il avait chassé des hommes-bêtes, et déterré des nains de leurs grottes, mais il y avait des limites. Des créatures de la fosse... Le Conter-maître, inquiet par tout ça, se retourna et se mit à courir. Un rire moqueur le suivit.[PARAGRAPH:1]Des choses étranges se produisirent dans le palais tandis que, un étage après l'autre, l'intrus se dirigeait vers le donjon, à dormait Keelyn. Des bougies magiques scintillèrent et moururent, des spectres psychédéliques maudirent les rêves de courtisans endormis, les amants furent insolemment interrompus par des tambourinements à la porte, des cadavres démembrés riants et d'autres nuisances très dérangeantes. Les gardes se retrouvèrent assoupis ou secoués d'accès incontrôlables de rire. Un groupe de personnes jouant à Somnium découvrirent que tout l'argent des mises avait été transformé en marbre. Une dispute éclata inévitablement.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le garde à la porte de Keelyn se trouva couvert de sueur glacée. Il avait la sensation très étrange de quelqu'un derrière lui, mais en se tournant vivement il ne vit personne. L'impression d'être épié ne le lachait pourtant pas. Il sentit une panique inexplicable s'emparer de lui et lança en bravades : "Qui est là ? Sortez de là et identifiez-vous ! Montrez-vous ou vous le paierez !" Il pivota, fouillant chaque recoin sombre du regard, espérant entrapercevoir quiconque se trouvait là. Il était certain que quelque chose continuait de se déplacer juste hors de son champ de vision. Ses cris se firent plus angoissés à mesure que la peur et la panique s'emparaient de lui. Il hurla finalement en désespoir de cause : "Bon dieu, ou êtes-vous, sortez !"[PARAGRAPH:1]Un petit visage jaillit juste devant son visage, sa tête au niveau de ses yeux. Il l'examina et se découvrit en train de contempler un viage en bois avec des yeux larges, fixes et miroitants. Le garde étouffa un cri tandis que la marionnette lui disait moqueusement " Viens, viens, viens !" Puis la marionnette aggripa sa tête de ses deux mains lisses et la tourna violemment, brisant sa nuque dans un joyeux "crac". Il s'effondra sur le sol, son expression figée en une expression surprise. La marionnette se posa sur la forme sans vie du garde et une petite trompette cuivrée également. LA marionnette la saisit maladroitement de sa main droite, et, tandis que les portes s'ouvraient de leur propre chef, les traversa, jouant une fanfare pompeuse qui s'interrompit avec un bruit sourd et un achoppement éxagérément comique tandis que le petit homme de bois se trouvait fusillé du regard par Keelyn. "Mes gardes du corps ne sont pas tes jouets !" sermonna-t-elle d'un ton cassant.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Mes gardes du corps ne sont pas tes jouets," répéta la marionnette irritée. Sa voix était celle d'un ventriloque, théâtrale, haut-perchée, irréelle et légèrement sinistre. Il lui tira une langue rouge. "Tu n'es pas drôle, Loki ! Descends de là tout de suite, ou affronte la colère de Ricaneur !" ordonna la princesse. La marionnette et la trompette furent brutalement tirées au travers de la porte puis au-dessus, et un visage peitn de manière spectaculaire apparut du dessus, regardant tête en bas à travers l'encadrement de la porte. Il arborait l'expression coupable mais suppliante de l'enfant pris la main dans le sac et qui sait bien ce qui va suivre. Keelyn caressait un lapin blanc avec de grands yeux rouges, de longs crocs jaunis et une expression haineuse. L'expression du visage de la princesse était juste sévère, mais c'était suffisant. "Tu vois ce que je veux dire, sur ton chemin." Une forme déguingaundée habillée de vêtements de couleurs criardes se déplia du dessus et fit une pirouette à travers la porte et atterrit dans une posture mélodramatique, et fit un sourire rapide et anormalement large. Puis, ignorant complètement Keelyn, il étudia la pièce du regard.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les chambres de Keelyn stimulaient le sens de l'humour de Loki. Elles contenaient tout ce qu'une chambre de princesse devrait contenir. Sur le mur, au-dessus du balcon se trouvait une tête de cheval, avec une seule corne protubérante au-dessus des yeux vitreux. Au-dessus de son lit formé de quatre gigantesques affiches (un mélange plein de bon goût de larges rubans roses, anthracite, de rideaux d'apparence huileuse et un crâne souriant et stylisé au-dessus de chaque coin d'affiche) se trouvait une peinture d'elle aux-côtés du corps pendant d'une autre créature ressemblant à un cheval, mais cette fois avec des ailes. Sur la peinture, elle avait un démon ailé grandeur nature perché de manière improbable sur son bras, comme un seigneur plus mondain porterait un faucon. Près des portes de son dressing, il y avait une collection de ce qui ressemblait à des papillons, mais après une inspection plus poussée, se révélaient être de petits humanoïdes ailés, épinglés et encadrés. Il y avait un bureau, une lourde table, avec le dessus constitué de marbre d'un cramoisi profond et supporté par quatre petites créatures dodues aux joues rouges, barbues et portant des chapeaux pointus. Il semblait que leur expression naturelle était "joviale", mais au lieu de cela leurs expressions étaient grimaçantes et tordues comme si elles étaient prises au piège d'un terrible tourment sans fin. Elles donnaient l'impression troublante d'être presque vivantes. Sur ce bureau se trouvait un encrier taillé dans un pied momifié. Il semblait en gros de la taille de celui d'un enfant et hyper poilu. Il y avait également un foetus flottant dans un vase rempli de liquide bleuté. On aurait pu le confondre avec un dauphin, sans ses petites mains et le début d'une tête et d'un abdomen. Enfin, suspendu au plafond dans une grande cage dorée se trouvait un diablotin.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le diablotin s'agita dans sa cage, remarqua Loki, et pris immédiatement la forme d'une superbe jeune femme complètement nue, faisant des gestes lubriques et le jetant des regards pervers. Loki regarda le spectacle avec une fascination détachée, mais aucune trace de désir. Voyant ça, le démon se transforma en un jeune homme nu particulièrement beau, mais avec le même effet. Il se transforma alors en une petite fille puis finalement en un petit garçon, tout en continuant les mouvements aguichants. Cela n'eut cependant aucun effet sur Loki, ce qui amena une expression fugace de confusion sur le visage du jeune garçon. Il commença alors à se transformer rapidement en de nombreuses formes : une pauvre vieille femme, un enfant pleurant, un chiot courant après sa queue et sautillant de partout, et toujours de nouvelles formes, de plus en plus vite. Loki était complètement fasciné par la démonstration, et la voix de Keelyn devint un faible bruit de fond. Le bruit stoppa, suivit par un gloussement outré et un claquement de doigts. Le diablotin fut projeté contre la cage, ramené à sa forme originelle, et écrasé contre les barreaux.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Je ne t'ai pas fait venir pour perdre ton temps à regarder les idioties de mes bêtes de compagnie", siffla Keelyn, contrôlant ce qui aurait certainement été un accès de colère très spectaculaire et destructeur. Loki lui en fut reconnaissant, bien qu'un peu triste que tout ce grabuge ne se produise pas, quand bien même il en aurait été la cible. "Je t'ai fait venir car j'ai besoin que tu joues certains tours à certaines personnes. Et d'ailleurs, ça amuse peut-être papa que tu te faufiles ici chaque fois qu'il t'appelle, mais pas moi, donc arrête ça." L'expression de Loki devint une grotesque tentative d'imitation d'enfant contrit, et commença a faire des petits minaudements. Impossible de dire s'il était sarcastique ou sincère. Tout ce que faisait Loki était très surjoué. S'il devait jamais parler, on l'imaginait tarabiscoté, pompeux, grave, bourré de pauses artistiques, plein d'intonations et une élocution soignée, tel un ténor narcissique dans un mauvais opéra. Mais il ne parlait jamais.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nul ne savait sic'était par choix ou par impossibilité, physique, mentale ou magique. Une chose était cependant sûre : tenir une conversation avec Loki était pratiquement impossible, et frustrante à en devenir fou. Aucune réponse, il n'utilisait même pas le langage des signes. Rien d'autre qu'un flot incessant d'espressions et gestes outrageants et souvent inappropriés, généralement plus troublants que révélateurs. Ce n'était cependant pas un problème pour le Prince Clown ou sa fille; Perpentach ne semblait même pas le remarquer, et pour Keelyn c'était dans l'ordre des choses. Comme tous les enfants gâtés, elle préférait les modes de communication à sens unique. Elle vous disait ce qu'elle voulait et c'était fini.[PARAGRAPH:1]"La raison pour laquelle je t'ai fait venir, c'est..." Elle prit une inspiration profonde, et Loki leva un sourcil naquois, vert foncé et très épais, en anticipant sa mission. "C'est que j'ai invoqué un nouvel ami l'autre jour, et il m'a dit qu'il existait un lieu bourré de nouveaux animaux de compagnie pour moi, et je lui ai dit que je voulais y aller, et il m'a demandé pourquoi laisser tout ça pour ça, que je pourrais être la Princesse, et j'ai pensé que mon vrai Royaume à moi ne serait aps aussi beau, et il m'a dit que ce ne serait pas aussi facile, et enfin il m'a dit que je ne serais pas seule," babilla Keelyn et la tête de Loki pencahit d'avant en arrière comme le levier d'une pompe, tandis qu'elle poursuivait : "Les Bannors aussi veulent y aller, ainsi que les Malakims. Et tout un tas d'autres gens, je crois, et je ne veux pas partager, mais je crois que je vais devoir jouer un peu avec eux parce que je crois que tous les compagnons ne seront pas aussi amicaux que Ricaneur et je ne sais pas si je pourrai convaincre papa de me donner assez de soldats pour tous les combattre seule et c'est pourquoi je veux que tu suives les autres et voir ce que tu peux découvrir et peut-être leur rendre les choses un peu plus difficiles, mais pas au point qu'ils deviennent inutiles pour moi. Peux-tu le faire ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki acquiesça doucement mais la lueur dévorante de ses yeux montrait qu'il pourrait le faire, et il pourrait le faire très, très bien. Keelyn ne manqua pas de le remarquer. "Je savais que tu aimerais ça, c'est à ça que tu es le meilleur. Un de mes jeux favoris est de suivre ta petite piste de destruction et confusion. J'ai même une carte où je les épingle. Donc vas-y et fait de ton pire. Ce sont mes ordres," finit-elle, du genre royal d'une petite fille qui savait pouvoir obtenir tout ce qu'ell edemandait. "Et ne tue aucun autre de mes gardes sur le chemin de la sortie. J'aime ceux que j'ai en ce moment."[PARAGRAPH:1]L'audience était terminée. Loki hocha une dernière fois la tête, et son sourire devint sinistre et donan l'impression de vouloir s'élargir plus que son visage. Il était sûrement à la recherche d'une telle mission. Puis il piqua un sprint, traversa la petite ouverture entre la chambre de Keelyn et le balcon et sauta. Il se maintint en l'air une seconde de plus que ce qui était physiquement possible, puis plongea à pic. Malgré elle, Keelyn se précipita à la rambarde et regarda en contrebas. Beaucoup, beaucoup plus bas, un visage haut en couleurs s'extrayait prestement d'une petite fontaine, s'égoutta, et disparut dans le jardin. Elle regarda le visage joyeux jusqu'à ce qu'il disparaisse à travers la haie limitant le jardin, en route pour semer discrètement le trouble et la discorde.
TEXT.German: [TAB]The animals in Keelyn's menagerie stirred uneasily in their sleep as a shadowy figure slipped past their cages. The apparition moved so quietly there was no way it would manage to stir even the most alert ones from slumber, yet, somehow, its passage managed to reach into their simple dreams and turn them sour. The shadow's progress was accompanied by a soft snicker of barely suppressed eagerness and anticipation. It sounded like a naughty schoolboy who was about to play a particularly nasty trick on his teacher.[PARAGRAPH:1]At the end of the row of cages stood a flight of broad, flat steps leading to an opulently carved door, a writhing mass of serpentine forms intertwining across its entire surface. This was the garden entrance to Keelyn's "Playpalace". The palace was decorated in the typical Balseraph manner, with no regard to taste, simplicity or uniformity, but rather treated as an opportunity to fit in as many festive, amusing, intricate, inventive, colorful and shiny details as possible. On the plus side, it provided plenty of footholds for a climber who regarded facades the same way an adventurous child regards trees. On the negative side, someone was so pleased with their work that they had seen fit to magically illuminate the whole thing, even in the middle of the night.[PARAGRAPH:1]The watch post at the aforementioned door shouted "Halt!", and squinted into the darkness, feeling sure he heard someone laughing. The laughing ended in an amused snort, and he caught something moving very fast at the edge of his vision. Before he had a chance to see what it was, it disappeared up the side of the building and through a open window with a skitter and a whoosh. He suddenly felt rather silly, reacting to what must surely have been a squirrel or a bird.[PARAGRAPH:1]The great hall of the palace was decorated like a fairy-tale palace, as envisioned by a particularly deranged practitioner of adult-oriented "art". The myriad candles went out in stages, starting at the front of the hall and moving towards the rear, a settling gloom advancing like a shadowy wave. It was followed by a low, tittering sound, someone laughing at their own personal joke. It was so low, it might as well have been the drafts playing tricks on the ear. The dark veil proceeded with stately dignity up the grand staircase and left the whole room in darkness.[PARAGRAPH:1]A huge Taskmaster on his way from a liaison with a courtesan bellowed "STOP!" at the top of his voice as he saw an unknown person sneaking into the hallway. The skulking figure appeared startled that he had seen him, and made a bolt for the nearest door-a move which brought a smile to the Taskmaster's face. That particular room was a "waiting room" for unwanted guests, specially designed to be unwelcoming and lacking certain amenities, like a floor of any kind. Well, that was not strictly true. There was a hard-packed earth surface about thirty feet below. As far as the Taskmaster was concerned, his intruder problem had solved itself almost as quickly as it had appeared. Then he heard a very conspicuous "creeeeeeak", and turned towards the source. The smile melted off his face as he spotted a jeering, otherworldly visage peering out from a door a little down the hall-since that door, too, led to the floorless chamber. This was obviously one of Keelyn's damned pets on the loose, certainly nothing for a mere mortal to get embroiled in. He had hunted beastmen, and dug dwarves out of their caves, but there were limits. Creatures from the pit... The Taskmaster, feared by so many, turned and ran. A mocking laugh followed him.[PARAGRAPH:1]Strange things happened throughout the palace as, floor by floor, the interloper made his way to the top tower, where Keelyn slept. Magical candles flickered and died, psychedelic spectres plagued the dreams of sleeping courtiers, lovers had their intimate moments rudely interrupted by loud knocking on the door, disembodied laughing or other highly disturbing noises. Guards found themselves nodding off or bursting into fits of uncontrollable giggling. A group of men playing Somnium found that all the money in the kitty had been replace with marbles. Predictably, a fight broke out.[PARAGRAPH:1]The guard in front of Keelyn's door felt himself break into a cold sweat. He had the strangest sensation that someone was standing behind him, but when he spun round, no one was there. The feeling of being watched would not loosen its grip, however. He felt an inexplicable panic rising in him, and began shouting out challenges: "Who goes there? Step forth, and be recognized! Show yourself, or there will be consequences!" He swung around, scanning every darkened corner, hoping to catch a glimpse of whoever was there. He was certain something kept moving on the edge of his vision. His cries became more and more distraught as the fear and panic swelled. Finally, he yelled in desperation: "Dammit, where are you, come out!"[PARAGRAPH:1]A small figure dropped down right in front of his face, its head at the level of his eyes. He focused on it, and found himself staring into a wooden face with large, unblinking, glassy eyes. The guard choked on his cry as the puppet mockingly chattered "Come out, come out, come out!" Then it grabbed his head with both polished hands and twisted sharply, snapping his neck with a merry "crack". He slumped to the ground, his features frozen in a final, surprised grimace. The puppet landed on the guard's lifeless form, and a small brass trumpet descended as well. The puppet seized it clumsily in its right hand, and, as the doors opened of their own accord, it marched through, playing a pompous fanfare that was cut short with a loud BLART and an exaggeratedly comical stumble as the little wooden man was met with the full force of Keelyn's glare. "My bodyguards are not your toys!" she snapped with an admonishing tone of voice.[PARAGRAPH:1]"My bodyguards are not your toys," the puppet repeated petulantly. It's voice was like that of a ventriloquist's dummy, theatrical, high-pitched, unreal and slightly eerie. It stuck a red-painted tongue out at her. "You're not funny, Loki! Come down from there at once, or face the wrath of Chuckles!" the princess commanded. Both puppet and trumpet were abruptly jerked through the door and up, and a spectacularly painted face appeared from above, looking upside down through the door frame. It bore the guilty but pleading expression of a child caught with a hand in the cookie jar and who now had a pretty good idea of what was to follow. Keelyn was stroking a white bunny with mean red eyes, sharp yellow fangs and a hateful expression. The princess' expression was merely stern, but bad enough. "You know what I mean, all the way down." A gangly form dressed in brightly colored clothes unfolded from above and swung through the doorway, landed with a melodramatic flourish, and flashed an unnaturally wide smile. Then, ignoring Keelyn completely, he proceeded to scan the room.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn's chambers appealed to Loki's sense of humor. They contained all the things the bedroom of a princess should contain. On the wall over the balcony was a horse's head, with one single horn protruding from above the glassy eyes. Above her gigantic four-poster bed (tastefully decked out in large pink ribbons, coal-black, oily-looking curtains and a grinning, stylized skull at the top of each corner post) was a painting of her standing beside the hanging corpse of another horse-like creature, this one with wings. In the painting, she had a full-sized winged demon improbably perched on her arm, in the same way a more mundane lord would carry a falcon. Next to the doorway of her dressing room, there was a collection of what appeared to be butterflies, but which, upon closer inspection, were small winged humanoids, pinned in frames. There was a desk, a heavy table-top of deep crimson marble supported by four short, chubby creatures with red cheeks, beards and pointy hats. They looked like their natural state was "jolly", but instead their features were twisted and distorted, as if in the throes of some terrible, unending torment. They were also suspiciously lifelike. Upon this desk there was an inkwell carved from a mummified foot. It was roughly child-sized, and extraordinarily hairy. There was also a fetus, floating in a jar of bluish liquid. One could be forgiven for thinking it was that of dolphin, were it not for the tiny hands and the beginnings of a head and abdomen. Finally, hanging from the roof in a large, gilded cage, there was an imp.[PARAGRAPH:1]The imp stirred in its cage, noticed Loki, and immediately changed shaped to a stunningly beautiful, completely naked young woman, making lewd gestures and sending him sultry looks. Loki watched the display with detached fascination, but no trace of lust. Seeing this, the demon changed to a remarkably pretty, naked young man, but got the same reaction. Then it changed into a little girl and finally a little boy, making seductive gestures all the time. It had no effect on Loki, however, and a look of confusion crossed the young boy's face. Then it started quickly flicking through a number of shapes-a distressed old lady, a crying baby, a puppy dog, wagging its tail and jumping up and down, and on, and on to new forms, faster and faster. Loki was completely enthralled by the display, and Keelyn's voice faded to a faint babble in the background. The babble stopped, and was followed by an outraged cluck, and a snap of the fingers. The imp was flung against the cage, shifted back to its original form, and slumped against the bars.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I did not call you here to waste time looking at the antics of my pets," Keelyn hissed, suppressing what would undoubtedly have been a rather spectacular and possibly destructive tantrum. Loki was glad she did, although also a bit sad at all the mayhem that was now not going to happen, even though it would have been directed at him. "I called you here because I need you to play some tricks on some people. And by the way, it may be that daddy thinks it is funny when you sneak in every time he calls for you, but I don't, so stop it." Loki's expression became a grotesque attempt at portraying a remorseful puppy, and he started making simpering sounds. It was impossible to tell if he was being sarcastic or if he was sincere. Everything Loki did was wildly overdone. If he ever spoke, one imagined it would be florid, pompous, loud, full of artistic pauses, meaningful stresses and careful enunciation, like a self-important tenor in a bad opera. But he never spoke.[PARAGRAPH:1]No one knew if he was mute by choice or compunction, physical, mental or magical. One thing was certain, though: Holding a conversation with Loki was nearly impossible, and frustrating to the point of madness. Not a single reply, he didn't even use sign language. Nothing but a ceaseless stream of outrageous and oft inappropriate expressions and gestures, more confusing than enlightening. This was not a problem for the Clown Prince or his daughter, however; Perpentach didn't seem to notice, and to Keelyn, this was the way things should be. Like all spoilt children, her preferred mode of communication was one-way. She told you what she wanted, and it was done.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The reason I summoned you, is..." She took a deep breath, and Loki cocked a very large, dark green eyebrow quizzically, anticipating his mission. "Is because I summoned a new friend the other day, and he told me there was this place with loads of new pets for me, and I told him I wanted to go this place, and he told me why leave it at that, I could be the Princess, and I thought, my very own Queendom, wouldn't that be grand, and he told me it wouldn't be easy, and then he told me I wouldn't be alone," Keelyn bubbled, and Loki's head bobbed up and down like a lever on a pump as she continued: "The Bannor want to go there too, and the Malakim. And loads of other people too, I think, and I don't want to have to share, but I think maybe I'll have to play with them for a bit because I don't think all of the pets living there will be as friendly as Chuckles and I don't know if I can get daddy to give me enough soldiers to go an' fight them all on my own and that's why I want you to tag along with the other guys and see what you can see and maybe make things a bit difficult for them, but not so much that they are useless for me. Can you do that?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki nodded sagely, but the hungry twinkle in his eye revealed that he could do that, and he could do that very, very well. Keelyn did not fail to notice it. "I knew you'd like this, it is what you're best at. One of my favorite games is following your little trail of destruction and confusion. I even have a map with pins in it. So go on, do your worst. That is my command," she finished, in the regal manner of a young girl who knew she could get whatever she demanded. "And don't kill any more of my guards on the way out. I like the ones I have at the moment."[PARAGRAPH:1]The audience was over. Loki nodded one last time, and his smile turned sinister and appeared to stretch broader than his face. He was obviously looking forward to this. Then he took a run up, ran through the opening between Keelyn's room and the balcony, and jumped. He hung in the air for a split second longer than should be physically possible, and then dived, straight down. Despite herself, Keelyn rushed to the parapet and looked down. Far, far below, a vividly colored figure hopped smartly out of a small fountain, shook the water off, and skipped through the garden. She watched the happy figure until it disappeared through a hedge at the boundary of the garden, bound for untold mischief and pandemonium.
TEXT.Italian: Gli animali nel serraglio di Keelyn si mosserò a disagio nel loro sonno mentre una figura indistinta passava affianco alle loro gabbie. L'ombra si muoveva cosi silenziosamente che persino gli animali più vigili non si sarebbero svegliati, eppure, in qualche modo, il suo passargli vicino riusciva a rendere più cupi i loro semplici sogni. Il progresso dell'ombra era accompagnato da una soffice risatina di impazienza e attesa a malapena soffocata. Sembrava come quella di uno studente impertinente che stava per fare un brutto scherzo al suo insegnante.[PARAGRAPH:1]Alla fine della fila di gabbie c'era un'ampia scalinata con i gradini piatti che conducevano a una porta scolpita in modo opulento, una massa contorta di forme serpentine si intrecciavano sulla superfice. Questa era l'entrata dal giardino al "Palazzo dei Giochi" di Keelyn. Il palazzo era decorato nella tipica maniera Balseraph, senza alcun riguardo per il gusto, la semplicità o la conformità, ma piuttosto venendo vista come un'opportunità per inserirci quanti più dettagli festivi, divertenti, intricati, colorati e lucenti possibili. Il lato positivo era che forniva molti appigli per uno scalatore che considera le facciate allo stesso modo in cui un bambino avventuroso considera gli alberi. Dal lato negativo, qualcuno era cosi soddisfatto di tale lavoro che gli sembrò giusto illuminare magicamente l'intera cosa, persino nel cuore della notte.[PARAGRAPH:1]La guardia posta alla porta di cui sopra gridò "Alt!", e cercò di vedere nell'oscurità, essendo sicura che aveva sentito qualcuno ridere. La risata si concluse con uno sbuffo divertito, e la guardia notò qualcosa muoversi molto velocemente al limite del suo campo di visuale. Prima di poter vedere cosa fosse, l'ombra sparì sul lato dell'edificio ed entrò in una finestra aperta causando solo un fruscio. La guardia penso improvvisamente di essere uno sciocco, preoccupandosi per quello che era stato sicuramente uno scoiattolo o un'uccellino.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il salone del palazzo era decorato come i palazzi nelle favole, come immaginate da un praticante particolarmente squilibrato delle arti "per adulti". Le miriadi di candele si spenserò a catena, iniziando dalla parte anteriore della stanza verso la parte posteriore, avanzando come fosse un'onda d'ombra. Era seguita da una lieve risatina, qualcuno rideva al suo stesso scherzo. Era cosi lieve che sarebbero potuti essere gli spifferi della stanza a ingannare le orecchie. Il velo d'oscurità continuò, con solenne signità, sulla grande scalinata lasciando la stanza completamente al buio.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un'imponente Aguzzino, che aveva appena finito un rapporto con una cortigiana, intimo a voce alta "STOP!" avendo notato una persona sconosciuta intrufolarsi nel corridoio. La figura nascosta trasalì al sapere di essere stata vista, e scattò verso la porta più vicina, un'azione che fece sorridere l'Aguzzino. Quella stanza era una "sala d'attesa" per gli ospiti indesiderati, appositamente pensata per essere spiacevole e senza alcuni comfort, come un pavimento di qualsiasi tipo. Beh, non era del tutto vero. C'era un pavimento in terra battuta circa 9 mentri più in basso. Per quanto riguardava l'Aguzzino, il suo problema con l'intruso si era risolto da solo con la stessa rapidità con la quale si era presentato. Poi sentì un sonoro "creeeeeeak", e si voltò verso la fonte. Il sorriso svanì dal suo volto quando vide un volto beffardo e ultraterreno spuntare da una porta poco più in la nel corridoio, visto che anche quella porta dava sulla stanza senza pavimento. Doveva sicuramente essere uno degli animali di Keelyn che era scappato, di sicuro non un qualcosa che un semplice mortale avrebbe dovuto affrontare. Aveva dato la caccia agli uomini bestia, e tirato fuori i nani dalle loro caverne, ma c'erano dei limiti. Le creature della fossa... L'Aguzzino, temuto da così tanti, si voltò e corse via. Una risata di scherno lo seguì.[PARAGRAPH:1]Accaddero cose strane in tutto il palazzo mentre, piano dopo piano, l'intruso si dirigeva verso la torre più alta, dove Keelyn dormiva. Le candele magiche tremolarono e si spensero, degli spettri psichedelici tormentavano i sogni dei cortigiani addormentati, gli amanti furono rudemente interrotti nei loro momenti intimi da un sonoro bussare sulle loro porte, da risate disincarnate o altri rumori altamente fastidiosi. Le guardie si ritrovarono ad annuire o a scoppiare in incontrollabili risatine. Un gruppo di uomini che giocavano a Somnium scoprirono che tutti i soldi messi nel piatto erano stati sostituiti da biglie. Com'era prevedibile, scoppiò una rissa.[PARAGRAPH:1]La guardia posta davanti alla porta di Keelyn iniziò a sudare freddo. Aveva la stranissima sensazione che qualcuno fosse dietro di lui, ma quando si girava, non c'era nessuno. La sensazione di essere osservato non se ne andava però. Sentì un panico inspiegabile crescere in lui, e iniziò a lanciare sfide ad alta voce: "Chi va là? Mostrati, e fatti riconoscere! Mostrati, o ci saranno delle conseguenze!" Guardandosi attorno, osservando attentamente ogni angolo buio, sperando di intravedere chiunque vi fosse. Era certo che c'era qualcosa che continuava a muoversi al limite del suo campo visivo. Le sue grida divennero sempre più turbate mentre la paura e il panico crescevano. Alla fine urlo in preda alla disperazione: "Dannazione, dove sei, vieni fuori!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Una piccola figura cadde proprio davanti alla sua faccia, la sua testa al livello dei suoi occhi. Concentrandosi su di essa scoprì che stava guardando una faccia di legno con grandi occhi vitrei. Alla guardia mancò l'aria quando il burattino lo schernì dicedo "Vieni fuori, vieni fuori, vieni fuori!" Per poi afferrare la testa della guardia con entrambe le sue mani levigate e girarla bruscamente, spezzandogli il collo con un sonoro "crack". La guardia si accasciò a terra, i suoi linemaneti bloccati in una smorfia sorpresa. Il burattino atterrò sul corpo senza vita della guardia, e una piccola tromba d'ottone scense insieme a lui. Il burattino la prese in maniera goffa nella sua mano destra, e, quando le porte si aprirono da sole, vi entrò, suonando una pomposa fanfara che fu interrotta da un forte "BLART" e un'inciampare esagerattamente comico quando il piccolo uomo di legno incontrò la piena potenza dello sguardo furioso di Keelyn. "Le mie guardie del corpo non sono i tuoi giocattoli!" sbottò con un tono di voce ammonitore.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Le mie guardie del corpo non sono i tuoi giocattoli," il burattino ripeté petulantemente. La sua voce era come quella di un pupazzo da ventriloquista, teatrale, acuta, irreale e leggermente inquietante. E fece la linguaccia verso di lei. "Non sei divertente, Loki! Scendi subito da li, o affronterai l'ira di Risatina!" la principessa ordinò. Sia il burattino che la tromba furono rapidamente tirati fuori dalla porta e in alto, e una faccia dipinta in modo spettacolare apparve dall'alto, osservando sottosopra dalla porta. Portava l'espressione colpevole ma implorante di un bambino colto con una mano nel barattolo dei biscotti e che ora aveva una chiara idea di cosa sarebbe successo. Keelyn stava accarezzando un coniglio bianco con spregevoli occhi rossi, acute zanne gialle e un'espressione colma d'odio. L'espressione della principessa era solamete severa, ma sufficentemente grave. "Sai cosa intendo, completamente a terra". Un corpo dinoccolato con vestiti dai colori vivaci scese da in alto e attraversò la porta, atterrandò con uno svolazzo melodrammatico, facendo un sorriso innaturalmente ampio. Poi, ignorando completamente Keelyn, procedette ad analizzare la stanza.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le stanze di Keelyn facevano appello al senso dello humor di Loki. Contenevano tutte le cose che una stanza da letto di una principessa avrebbe dovuto contenere. Sulla parete della balconata c'era una testa di cavallo, con un singolo corno in mezzo alla fronte. Sopra il suo gigantesco letto a baldacchino (finemente decorato con grandi fiocchi rosa, delle tende oleose color carbone e con un teschio gighiante stilizzato all'apice di ogni angolo) c'era un dipinto che ritraeva lei accanto al cadavere penzolante di un'altra creatura simile a un cavallo, però che aveva delle ali. Nel dipinto, aveva, appollaiato sul braccio, un demone alato di dimensioni normali, allo stesso modo di come un signore più mondano portava un falco. Accanto alla porta del suo camerino, c'era una collezione di quelle che sembravano essere farfalle, ma che, in seguito ad un'ispezione più attenta, erano piccoli umanoidi alati, attaccati alle cornici. C'era una scrivania, un pesante tavolo di marmo cremisi scuro sostenuto da quattro corte creature paffute con guance, barbe e cappelli a punta rossi. Sembrava fossero "allegri", mentre i loro lineamenti erano distorti e storpiati, come in preda a un terribile, interminabile tormento. Erano anche sospettosamente realistici. Sulla scrivania vi era un calamaio ottenuto da un piede mummificato. Era delle dimensioni circa di quelli da bambino, e straordinariamente peloso. C'era anche un feto, immerso in un liquido bluastro in un barattolo. Si sarebbe potuto tranquillamente pensare che fosse di un delfino, se non fosse stato per le piccole mani e il principio di una testa e di un'addome. Infine, penzolante dal soffitto, c'era una grande gabbia dorata con all'interno un Imp.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'Imp si mosse nella sua gabbia, notando Loki, e subitò cambio forma diventando un'incredibilmente bella ragazza nuda, facendo gesti lussuriosi e guardandolo in modo appassionato. Loki guardò l'esibizioe con distaccato interesse, ma senza alcuna traccia di lussuria. Notando ciò, il demone si trasformò in un giovane straordinariamente bello e nudo, ma la reazione di di Loki fu uguale. Poi diventò una bambina e infine un bambino, facendo gesti seducenti per tutto il tempo. Non aveva alcun effetto su Loki però, e uno sguardo confuso apparve sul volto del bambino. Poi inizio a cambiare rapidamente in diverse forme consecutive, una vecchia signora in difficoltà, un bambino che piange, un cucciolo di cane che scodinzolava saltando su e giu, e via dicendo sempre più veloce. Loki era completamente incantato dall'esibizione, e la voce di Keelyn divenne un flebile balbettio in sottofondo. Il balbettio si fermo, ma seguì un grido irato e uno schiocco di dita. L'Imp fu scagliato contro la gabbia, tornando alla sua forma originale, e si accasciò contro le sbarre.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Non ti ho chiamato qui per perdere tempo guardando le buffonate dei miei animali" Keelyn sibilò, sopprimendo quella che sarebbe stato indubbiamente uno scatto d'ira particolarmente spettaccolare e probabilmente distruttivo. Loki fu grato di ciò, anche se un pò triste per tutto il caos che non sarebbe avvenuto, anche se sarebbe stato diretto contro di lui. "Ti ho chiamato qui perché ho bisogno che tu faccia qualche scherzo ad alcune persone. E comunque, papà potrebbe pensare che è divertente quando ti intrufoli ogni volta che ti chiama, ma io no, quindi smettila". L'espressione di Loki divenne un grottesco tentativo di ritrarre un cucciolo pieno di rimorsi, iniziandò a simularne persino i guaiti. Era impossibile dire se fosse sarcastico o se fosse sincero. Ogni cosa che Loki faceva era sempre esaggerata. Se mai parlava, uno si sarebbe immaginato fosse in modo fiorito, pomposo, ad alta voce, pieno di pause artistiche, sollecitazioni significative e attente enunciazioni, come un'arrogante tenore all'interno di una cattiva opera.
