Ma lui non parlava mai.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nessuno sapeva se era muto per scelta o per via di una costrizione fisica, mentale o magica. Una cosa era certa però: Conversare con Loki era quasi impossibile, e frustrante fino alla follia. Neppure una risposta, non usava neppure il linguaggio dei segni. Nient'altro che una serie incessante di espressioni oltraggiose e spesso inappropriate e gesti che confondevano ancora di più anzichè aiutare a capire. Questo non era un problema per il Principe Pagliaccio o sua figlia però; Perpentach non sembrava averlo notato, e per Keelyn era cosi che le cose sarebbero dovute essere. Come tutti i bambini viziati, il suo modo preferito di conversare era a un solo verso. Lei ti diceva cosa voleva e basta.[PARAGRAPH:1]"La ragione per cui ti ho convocato, è..." E fece un respiro profondo, mentre Loki inarcò interrogativamente un sopraciglio verde scuro molto grande, prevedendo la sua missione. "È perché ho evocato un nuovo amico l'altro giorno, che mi ha detto che c'era un posto pieno di nuovi animaletti per me, e gli ho detto che volevo andare in questo posto, e mi ha detto perché fermarsi a questo, potrei essere la Principessa, e ho pensato, il mio personale regno, non sarebbe grandioso? Mi ha anche detto che non sarebbe stato facile, e poi mi ha detto che non sarei stata sola" Keelyn era effervescente, e la testa di Loki continuava a ballonzare su e giu mentre lei continuava: "Anche i Bannor ci vogliono andare, e pure i Malakim. E anche un sacco di altra gente, credo, e non voglio doverlo condividere, ma penso che potrei giocare con loro per un pò perché non credo che tutti gli animaletti che vivono li siano amichevoli come Risatina e non so se riesco a farmi dare abbastanza soldati da papà per andare a combatterli tutti da sola ed è per questo che voglio che tu vada dagli altri per vedere cosa stanno facendo e magari rendergli le cose un pò più difficili, ma non troppo che poi mi sono inutili. Puoi farlo?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki annuì saggiamente, ma il luccichio nei suoi occhi rivelava che poteva veramente farlo, e lo poteva fare molto, molto bene. Keelyn non mancò di notarlo. "Sapevo ti sarebbe piaciuto, e la cosa che ti riesce meglio. Uno dei miei giochi preferiti è seguire la tua piccola scia di distruzione e confusione. Ho persino una mappa in cui le segno con degli spilli. Quindi vai, fai del tuo peggio. Questo è il mio ordine" concluse, nel modo regale di una ragazza che sapeva di poter ottenere tutto ciò che chiedeva. "E non uccidere altre delle mie guardie uscendo. Mi piacciono quelle che ho al momento".[PARAGRAPH:1]L'udienza era finita. Loki annuì un'ultima volta, e il suo sorriso si fece losco e sembrava allargarsi più del suo viso. Era ovvio che Loki non vedeva l'ora di mettersi all'opera. Poi prese la rincorsa, attraversò la stanza di Keelyn e saltò dal balcone. Rimase in aria per mezzo secondo in più di quanto sarebbe possibile fisicamente, e poi andò in piacchiata verso il basso. Suo malgrado, Keelyn corse al parapetto e guardò giù. Molto molto più in basso, una figura dai colori vivaci saltava fuori elegantemente da una piccola fontana, si scrollò l'acqua di dosso, e attraversò saltellando il giardino. Guardò la figura felice finché non scomparve attraverso una siepe al confine del giardino, diretta a fare indicibili malvagità e causare un putiferio.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The animals in Keelyn's menagerie stirred uneasily in their sleep as a shadowy figure slipped past their cages. The apparition moved so quietly there was no way it would manage to stir even the most alert ones from slumber, yet, somehow, its passage managed to reach into their simple dreams and turn them sour. The shadow's progress was accompanied by a soft snicker of barely suppressed eagerness and anticipation. It sounded like a naughty schoolboy who was about to play a particularly nasty trick on his teacher.[PARAGRAPH:1]At the end of the row of cages stood a flight of broad, flat steps leading to an opulently carved door, a writhing mass of serpentine forms intertwining across its entire surface. This was the garden entrance to Keelyn's "Playpalace". The palace was decorated in the typical Balseraph manner, with no regard to taste, simplicity or uniformity, but rather treated as an opportunity to fit in as many festive, amusing, intricate, inventive, colorful and shiny details as possible. On the plus side, it provided plenty of footholds for a climber who regarded facades the same way an adventurous child regards trees. On the negative side, someone was so pleased with their work that they had seen fit to magically illuminate the whole thing, even in the middle of the night.[PARAGRAPH:1]The watch post at the aforementioned door shouted "Halt!", and squinted into the darkness, feeling sure he heard someone laughing. The laughing ended in an amused snort, and he caught something moving very fast at the edge of his vision. Before he had a chance to see what it was, it disappeared up the side of the building and through a open window with a skitter and a whoosh. He suddenly felt rather silly, reacting to what must surely have been a squirrel or a bird.[PARAGRAPH:1]The great hall of the palace was decorated like a fairy-tale palace, as envisioned by a particularly deranged practitioner of adult-oriented "art". The myriad candles went out in stages, starting at the front of the hall and moving towards the rear, a settling gloom advancing like a shadowy wave. It was followed by a low, tittering sound, someone laughing at their own personal joke. It was so low, it might as well have been the drafts playing tricks on the ear. The dark veil proceeded with stately dignity up the grand staircase and left the whole room in darkness.[PARAGRAPH:1]A huge Taskmaster on his way from a liaison with a courtesan bellowed "STOP!" at the top of his voice as he saw an unknown person sneaking into the hallway. The skulking figure appeared startled that he had seen him, and made a bolt for the nearest door-a move which brought a smile to the Taskmaster's face. That particular room was a "waiting room" for unwanted guests, specially designed to be unwelcoming and lacking certain amenities, like a floor of any kind. Well, that was not strictly true. There was a hard-packed earth surface about thirty feet below. As far as the Taskmaster was concerned, his intruder problem had solved itself almost as quickly as it had appeared. Then he heard a very conspicuous "creeeeeeak", and turned towards the source. The smile melted off his face as he spotted a jeering, otherworldly visage peering out from a door a little down the hall-since that door, too, led to the floorless chamber. This was obviously one of Keelyn's damned pets on the loose, certainly nothing for a mere mortal to get embroiled in. He had hunted beastmen, and dug dwarves out of their caves, but there were limits. Creatures from the pit... The Taskmaster, feared by so many, turned and ran. A mocking laugh followed him.[PARAGRAPH:1]Strange things happened throughout the palace as, floor by floor, the interloper made his way to the top tower, where Keelyn slept. Magical candles flickered and died, psychedelic spectres plagued the dreams of sleeping courtiers, lovers had their intimate moments rudely interrupted by loud knocking on the door, disembodied laughing or other highly disturbing noises. Guards found themselves nodding off or bursting into fits of uncontrollable giggling. A group of men playing Somnium found that all the money in the kitty had been replace with marbles. Predictably, a fight broke out.[PARAGRAPH:1]The guard in front of Keelyn's door felt himself break into a cold sweat. He had the strangest sensation that someone was standing behind him, but when he spun round, no one was there. The feeling of being watched would not loosen its grip, however. He felt an inexplicable panic rising in him, and began shouting out challenges: "Who goes there? Step forth, and be recognized! Show yourself, or there will be consequences!" He swung around, scanning every darkened corner, hoping to catch a glimpse of whoever was there. He was certain something kept moving on the edge of his vision. His cries became more and more distraught as the fear and panic swelled. Finally, he yelled in desperation: "Dammit, where are you, come out!"[PARAGRAPH:1]A small figure dropped down right in front of his face, its head at the level of his eyes. He focused on it, and found himself staring into a wooden face with large, unblinking, glassy eyes. The guard choked on his cry as the puppet mockingly chattered "Come out, come out, come out!" Then it grabbed his head with both polished hands and twisted sharply, snapping his neck with a merry "crack". He slumped to the ground, his features frozen in a final, surprised grimace. The puppet landed on the guard's lifeless form, and a small brass trumpet descended as well. The puppet seized it clumsily in its right hand, and, as the doors opened of their own accord, it marched through, playing a pompous fanfare that was cut short with a loud BLART and an exaggeratedly comical stumble as the little wooden man was met with the full force of Keelyn's glare. "My bodyguards are not your toys!" she snapped with an admonishing tone of voice.[PARAGRAPH:1]"My bodyguards are not your toys," the puppet repeated petulantly. It's voice was like that of a ventriloquist's dummy, theatrical, high-pitched, unreal and slightly eerie. It stuck a red-painted tongue out at her. "You're not funny, Loki! Come down from there at once, or face the wrath of Chuckles!" the princess commanded. Both puppet and trumpet were abruptly jerked through the door and up, and a spectacularly painted face appeared from above, looking upside down through the door frame. It bore the guilty but pleading expression of a child caught with a hand in the cookie jar and who now had a pretty good idea of what was to follow. Keelyn was stroking a white bunny with mean red eyes, sharp yellow fangs and a hateful expression. The princess' expression was merely stern, but bad enough. "You know what I mean, all the way down." A gangly form dressed in brightly colored clothes unfolded from above and swung through the doorway, landed with a melodramatic flourish, and flashed an unnaturally wide smile. Then, ignoring Keelyn completely, he proceeded to scan the room.[PARAGRAPH:1]Keelyn's chambers appealed to Loki's sense of humor. They contained all the things the bedroom of a princess should contain. On the wall over the balcony was a horse's head, with one single horn protruding from above the glassy eyes. Above her gigantic four-poster bed (tastefully decked out in large pink ribbons, coal-black, oily-looking curtains and a grinning, stylized skull at the top of each corner post) was a painting of her standing beside the hanging corpse of another horse-like creature, this one with wings. In the painting, she had a full-sized winged demon improbably perched on her arm, in the same way a more mundane lord would carry a falcon. Next to the doorway of her dressing room, there was a collection of what appeared to be butterflies, but which, upon closer inspection, were small winged humanoids, pinned in frames. There was a desk, a heavy table-top of deep crimson marble supported by four short, chubby creatures with red cheeks, beards and pointy hats. They looked like their natural state was "jolly", but instead their features were twisted and distorted, as if in the throes of some terrible, unending torment. They were also suspiciously lifelike. Upon this desk there was an inkwell carved from a mummified foot. It was roughly child-sized, and extraordinarily hairy. There was also a fetus, floating in a jar of bluish liquid. One could be forgiven for thinking it was that of dolphin, were it not for the tiny hands and the beginnings of a head and abdomen. Finally, hanging from the roof in a large, gilded cage, there was an imp.[PARAGRAPH:1]The imp stirred in its cage, noticed Loki, and immediately changed shaped to a stunningly beautiful, completely naked young woman, making lewd gestures and sending him sultry looks. Loki watched the display with detached fascination, but no trace of lust. Seeing this, the demon changed to a remarkably pretty, naked young man, but got the same reaction. Then it changed into a little girl and finally a little boy, making seductive gestures all the time. It had no effect on Loki, however, and a look of confusion crossed the young boy's face. Then it started quickly flicking through a number of shapes-a distressed old lady, a crying baby, a puppy dog, wagging its tail and jumping up and down, and on, and on to new forms, faster and faster. Loki was completely enthralled by the display, and Keelyn's voice faded to a faint babble in the background. The babble stopped, and was followed by an outraged cluck, and a snap of the fingers. The imp was flung against the cage, shifted back to its original form, and slumped against the bars.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I did not call you here to waste time looking at the antics of my pets," Keelyn hissed, suppressing what would undoubtedly have been a rather spectacular and possibly destructive tantrum. Loki was glad she did, although also a bit sad at all the mayhem that was now not going to happen, even though it would have been directed at him. "I called you here because I need you to play some tricks on some people. And by the way, it may be that daddy thinks it is funny when you sneak in every time he calls for you, but I don't, so stop it." Loki's expression became a grotesque attempt at portraying a remorseful puppy, and he started making simpering sounds. It was impossible to tell if he was being sarcastic or if he was sincere. Everything Loki did was wildly overdone. If he ever spoke, one imagined it would be florid, pompous, loud, full of artistic pauses, meaningful stresses and careful enunciation, like a self-important tenor in a bad opera. But he never spoke.[PARAGRAPH:1]No one knew if he was mute by choice or compunction, physical, mental or magical. One thing was certain, though: Holding a conversation with Loki was nearly impossible, and frustrating to the point of madness. Not a single reply, he didn't even use sign language. Nothing but a ceaseless stream of outrageous and oft inappropriate expressions and gestures, more confusing than enlightening. This was not a problem for the Clown Prince or his daughter, however; Perpentach didn't seem to notice, and to Keelyn, this was the way things should be. Like all spoilt children, her preferred mode of communication was one-way. She told you what she wanted, and it was done.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The reason I summoned you, is..." She took a deep breath, and Loki cocked a very large, dark green eyebrow quizzically, anticipating his mission. "Is because I summoned a new friend the other day, and he told me there was this place with loads of new pets for me, and I told him I wanted to go this place, and he told me why leave it at that, I could be the Princess, and I thought, my very own Queendom, wouldn't that be grand, and he told me it wouldn't be easy, and then he told me I wouldn't be alone," Keelyn bubbled, and Loki's head bobbed up and down like a lever on a pump as she continued: "The Bannor want to go there too, and the Malakim. And loads of other people too, I think, and I don't want to have to share, but I think maybe I'll have to play with them for a bit because I don't think all of the pets living there will be as friendly as Chuckles and I don't know if I can get daddy to give me enough soldiers to go an' fight them all on my own and that's why I want you to tag along with the other guys and see what you can see and maybe make things a bit difficult for them, but not so much that they are useless for me. Can you do that?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki nodded sagely, but the hungry twinkle in his eye revealed that he could do that, and he could do that very, very well. Keelyn did not fail to notice it. "I knew you'd like this, it is what you're best at. One of my favorite games is following your little trail of destruction and confusion. I even have a map with pins in it. So go on, do your worst. That is my command," she finished, in the regal manner of a young girl who knew she could get whatever she demanded. "And don't kill any more of my guards on the way out. I like the ones I have at the moment."[PARAGRAPH:1]The audience was over. Loki nodded one last time, and his smile turned sinister and appeared to stretch broader than his face. He was obviously looking forward to this. Then he took a run up, ran through the opening between Keelyn's room and the balcony, and jumped. He hung in the air for a split second longer than should be physically possible, and then dived, straight down. Despite herself, Keelyn rushed to the parapet and looked down. Far, far below, a vividly colored figure hopped smartly out of a small fountain, shook the water off, and skipped through the garden. She watched the happy figure until it disappeared through a hedge at the boundary of the garden, bound for untold mischief and pandemonium.

TEXT.English: Fun to play with, horrible to play against, most leaders would rather see a berserker horde wander into their lands than the clown prince. Loki can take gold from rival cities or cause unrest in the cities and flip them to the Balseraphs if their culture gets low enough.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki can investigate cities and has effective spells for charming enemy units, but his most frustrating ability is that he is the most difficult unit in the game to kill. When attacked he simply runs away to any open tiles around him. Loki must be cornered or completely surrounded before he can be killed in combat.
TEXT.French: Amusant à jouer et horrible à affronter, la plupart des dirigeants préféreraient voir une horde de barserkers errant sur leurs terres que le prince clown. Loki peut prendre de l'or aux villes rivales, ou causer des troubles dans les villes, et les convertir pour les Balséraphs si leur culture est suffisamment basse.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki peut étudier les villes et a des sorts utiles pour charmer les unités ennemies, mais sa capacité la plus frustrante est qu'il est l'unité du jeu la plus difficile à tuer. Quand il est attaqué, il fuit simplement sur n'importe quelle case autour de lui. Loki doit être coincé ou complètement encerclé avant de pouvoir le tuer en combat.
TEXT.German: Es ist ein Spaß mit ihm zu spielen, jedoch ein Albtraum, gegen ihn zu spielen. Die meisten Herrscher würden lieber einer Horde von Berserkern in ihr Land einfallen sehen als den Clown-Prinzen. Loki verursacht den gleichen Effekt wie ein Zigeuner-Trek: Er reduziert den Kultur- und Gold-Ausstoß von jeder Stadt in der er sich aufhält (außer von denen seiner eigenen Zivilisation). Des weiteren verursacht er Unruhen und kann die Stadt für die Balseraphs übernehmen, wenn ihr Kulturwert zu niedrig wird.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki kann Städte auskundschaften und verfügt über effektive Zauber, um feindliche Einheiten zu bezaubern oder zu verwirren. Seine frustrierendste Eigenschaft ist jedoch, dass er die am schwersten zu tötende Einheit im Spiel ist. Wenn er angegriffen wird, rennt er einfach auf ein beliebiges freies Feld um ihn herum davon. Loki muss in die Ecke getrieben werden oder komplett mit feindlichen Einheiten umgeben sein, bevor er im Kampf getötet werden kann.
TEXT.Italian: Divertente da giocare, orribile averlo contro, la maggior parte dei leader preferirebbe vedere un'orda di berserker vagare nelle loro terre pittosto che lui. Loki può prendere oro dalle città rivali o cousare disordini in esse e convertirle ai Balseraph se la loro cultura diventa abbastanza bassa.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki può ispezionare le città e ha magie efficaci per affascinare le unità avversarie, ma la sua abilità più frustrante è che è l'unità più difficile da uccidere di tutto il gioco. Quando viene attaccato lui semplicemente scappa via in qualsiasi casella disponibile attorno a lui. Loki deve essere messo all'angolo o completamente circondato prima che posso venir ucciso in combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Fun to play with, horrible to play against, most leaders would rather see a berserker horde wander into their lands than the clown prince. Loki can take gold from rival cities or cause unrest in the cities and flip them to the Balseraphs if their culture gets low enough.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loki can investigate cities and has effective spells for charming enemy units, but his most frustrating ability is that he is the most difficult unit in the game to kill. When attacked he simply runs away to any open tiles around him. Loki must be cornered or completely surrounded before he can be killed in combat.

TEXT.English: Mimic
TEXT.French: Mime
TEXT.German: Formwandler
TEXT.Italian: Mimo
TEXT.Spanish: Mimic

TEXT.English: Those Merrymen most amusing to Perpentach are likely to be trained in the art of pantomime. Balseraph mimes use more than paint and expression, however; they also have subtle mind magic. Not entirely under their control, this grants them insight into their subjects that translates into fantastic combat abilities, especially combined with their lithe forms and sadistic sense of humor.
TEXT.French: Ces clowns dédiés à l'amusement de Perpentach peuvent être entrainés à l'art de la Pantomime. Les Mimes Balséraphs utilisent toutefois plus que du maquillage et des expressions. Ils possèdent une subtile magie de la pensée. Pas entièrement contrôlée, elle leur confère la connaissance intime de leurs cibles et se traduit par de fantastiques capacités de combat, particulièrement combinée avec leur agilité et leur sens de l'humour sadique.
TEXT.German: Die Unterhaltungskünstler, die Perpentach am meisten begeistern, werden in der Kunst der Pantomime ausgebildet. Baseraphische Formwandler benutzen mehr als Beschreibungen und Ausdruck, und sie nutzen die subtile Magie des Geistes. Obwohl sie diese nicht vollständig unter Kontrolle haben, gibt sie ihnen einen tieferen Einblick in ihren Gegenüber, und daraus ergeben sich hervorragende Kampfeigenschaften, insbesondere gepaart mit ihren schwer zu erfassenden Gestalten und ihrem sadistischen Sinn für Humor.
TEXT.Italian: Gli animatori ritenuti più divertenti da Perpentach potrebbero venir istruiti nell'arte della pantomima. Ma i mimi Balseraph usano anche altro oltre al trucco facciale e alle espressioni; possiedono infatti anche una discreta abilità nella magia della mente. Sebbene non interamente sotto il loro controllo, questa abilità gli conferisce un particolare intuitò che porta poi a delle fantastiche capacità di combattimento, specialmente quando combinate con la loro agilità e il loro senso dello humor sadico.
TEXT.Spanish: Those Merrymen most amusing to Perpentach are likely to be trained in the art of pantomime. Balseraph mimes use more than paint and expression, however; they also have subtle mind magic. Not entirely under their control, this grants them insight into their subjects that translates into fantastic combat abilities, especially combined with their lithe forms and sadistic sense of humor.

TEXT.English: Mimics can steal a random promotion from units they defeat in combat.
TEXT.French: Les Mimes peuvent voler une promotion aléatoire des unités vaincues au combat.
TEXT.German: Formwandler stehlen von Einheiten die sie im Kampf besiegen eine zufällige Beförderung
TEXT.Italian: I Mimi possono rubare una promozione a caso dalle unità che sconfiggono in combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Mimics can steal a random promotion from units they defeat in combat.

TEXT.English: Puppet
TEXT.French: Marionnette
TEXT.German: Puppe
TEXT.Italian: Burattino
TEXT.Spanish: Puppet

TEXT.English: Puppets gain the spell casting abilities of their creator. Which allows casters to send their puppets into dangerous situations while remaining well away from the battle. They are also useful for casting spells that can be dangerous for the caster like Wonder or Domination.
TEXT.French: Les Marionnettes obtiennent les capacités de lanceur de sorts de leurs créateurs. Ce qui permet à ces créateurs d'envoyer leurs marionnettes dans des situations dangereuses tout en restant hors des combats. Elles sont également utiles pour lancer des sorts dangereux comme Merveille ou Domination.
TEXT.German: Puppen erhalten die Zauberspruchfertigkeiten ihrer Erschaffer. Das erlaubt Zauberern, ihre Puppen in gefährliche Situationen zu schicken, während sie selber Abstand von der Schlacht halten. Sie sind außerdem sinnvoll, um Sprüche zu sprechen, die für den Zauberer gefährlich sein können, wie zum Beispiel Wunder oder Kontrolle übernehmen.
TEXT.Italian: I Burattini ottengono la capacità di lanciare le stesse magie dei loro creatori. Ciò permette agli incantatori di mandare i loro burattini in zone pericolose mentre loro rimangono lontani dalla battaglia. Sono anche utili per lanciare magie che possono essere pericolose per chi le lancia come la magia Portento o la magia Dominazione.
TEXT.Spanish: Puppets gain the spell casting abilities of their creator. Which allows casters to send their puppets into dangerous situations while remaining well away from the battle. They are also useful for casting spells that can be dangerous for the caster like Wonder or Domination.

TEXT.English: Taskmaster
TEXT.French: Contre-Maître
TEXT.German: Knechtmeister
TEXT.Italian: Aguzzino
TEXT.Spanish: Taskmaster

TEXT.English: Vicious brutes completely unconcerned with the suffering of others. They take after their leader in that respect, but do not share Perpentach's sense of humor. The taskmaster will turn defeated units into slaves, which can be used as workers or added to a Balseraph city in cages as attractions.
TEXT.French: De brutes vicieuses qui se moquent des souffrances des autres. Ils respectent leur chef, mais ne partagent pas le sens de l'humour de Perpentach. Le Contre-Maître convertira les unités vaincues en esclaves, qui pourront être utilisés comme ouvriers ou ajoutés aux villes Balséraphs comme attractions dans des cages.
TEXT.German: Heimtückische Rohlinge, unberührt vom Leid Anderer. Darin stehen sie ihren Anführern in nichts nach. Der Knechtmeister macht aus besiegten Einheiten Sklaven, die als Arbeiter genutzt werden oder einer Abnormitätenschau der Balseraph hinzugefügt werden.
TEXT.Italian: Violenti bruti che sono indifferenti alla sofferenza altrui. Sono come il loro leader su questo aspetto, ma non hanno lo stesso senso dello humor di Perpentach.
TEXT.Spanish: Vicious brutes completely unconcerned with the suffering of others. They take after their leader in that respect, but do not share Perpentach's sense of humor. The taskmaster will turn defeated units into slaves, which can be used as workers or added to a Balseraph city in cages as attractions.

TEXT.English: The taskmaster will turn defeated units into slaves, which can be used as workers or added to a Balseraph city. Taskmasters also start with marksmen promotion, meaning that they will target the weakest units first.
TEXT.French: Le Contre-Maître convertira les unités vaincues en esclaves, qui pourront être utilisés comme ouvriers ou ajoutés aux villes Balséraphs. Le Contre-Maître commence également avec la promotion Tireur d'Élite, signifiant qu'il s'attaquera d'abord à l'unité la plus faible.
TEXT.German: Der Knechtmeister versklavt besiegte Einheiten, welche als Arbeitstrupps eingesetzt, oder als Attraktionen einer Abnormitätenschau verwendet werden können.
TEXT.Italian: L'Aguzzino ha una probabilità del 25% di trasformare un'unità sconfitta in combattimento in uno schiavo, che possono essere usati come lavoratori, sacrificati per accelerare la produzione di una città o sacrificati per creare delle gabbie che fungono da attrazione nelle città Balseraph. Gli Aguzzini iniziano con la promozione marksmen, che gli permette di attaccare l'unità più debole all'interno di un'eventuale gruppo.
TEXT.Spanish: The taskmaster will turn defeated units into slaves, which can be used as workers or added to a Balseraph city. Taskmasters also start with marksmen promotion, meaning that they will target the weakest units first.
